articles.headline: Chinese Property Developer Kaisa Defaults on Debt
articles.snippet: The Kaisa Group said it missed two large interest payments due last month on about $1 billion in corporate bonds denominated in United States dollars.
articles.abstract: The Kaisa Group said it missed two large interest payments due last month on about $1 billion in corporate bonds denominated in United States dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: The troubled Chinese property developer Kaisa Group has defaulted on its overseas debt, a situation that could make Western investors more wary of the country’s real estate market.

articles.headline: A Veteran of the Financial Crisis Tells China to Be Wary
articles.snippet: Henry M. Paulson, Treasury secretary during the 2008 financial crisis, warns China in a new book that it will undoubtedly have to “face a reckoning.”
articles.abstract: Henry M. Paulson, Treasury secretary during the 2008 financial crisis, warns China in a new book that it will undoubtedly have to “face a reckoning.”
articles.lead_paragraph: About 340 pages into Henry M. Paulson’s new book on China, a sentence comes almost out of nowhere that stops readers in their tracks.

articles.headline: New Genetic Tests for Breast Cancer Hold Promise
articles.snippet: Two advances in tests for the genes that carry an added risk of breast cancer promise to make the process less expensive and more precise.
articles.abstract: Two advances in tests for the genes that carry an added risk of breast cancer promise to make the process less expensive and more precise.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Silicon Valley start-up with some big-name backers is threatening to upend genetic screening for breast and ovarian cancer by offering a test on a sample of saliva that is so inexpensive that most women could get it.

articles.headline: Former SS Member, on Trial in Germany, Says He Was ‘Morally Complicit’ at Auschwitz
articles.snippet: Oskar Gröning, 93, is charged with complicity in the murder of 300,000 prisoners at the Nazi death camp in 1944.
articles.abstract: Oskar Gröning, 93, is charged with complicity in the murder of 300,000 prisoners at the Nazi death camp in 1944.
articles.lead_paragraph: LÜNEBURG, Germany — Seven decades after the liberation of Auschwitz, a 93-year-old former SS member at the Nazi death camp shuffled into a German court on Tuesday to answer charges of complicity in the murders of 300,000 mostly Hungarian Jews in two months during the summer of 1944.

articles.headline: Teva, Maker of Generic Drugs, Bids $40 Billion to Acquire Its Rival Mylan
articles.snippet: The unsolicited offer of $82 a share would scuttle Mylan’s proposed acquisition of Perrigo in a shake-up of the generic drug industry.
articles.abstract: The unsolicited offer of $82 a share would scuttle Mylan’s proposed acquisition of Perrigo in a shake-up of the generic drug industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eat or be eaten. That is the philosophy among drug makers that is underpinning a frenzied burst of consolidation and rapidly reshaping the global pharmaceutical industry.

articles.headline: Unpaid Russian Workers Unite in Protest Against Putin
articles.snippet: After the annexation of Crimea, workers discontented over unpaid wages and forced vacations have generated a wave of labor actions.
articles.abstract: After the annexation of Crimea, workers discontented over unpaid wages and forced vacations have generated a wave of labor actions.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — In the far east, the teachers went on strike. In central Russia, it was the employees of a metallurgical plant. In St. Petersburg, autoworkers laid down their tools. And at a remote construction site in Siberia, laborers painted their complaints in gigantic white letters on the roofs of their dormitories.
